{"step_by_step_thinking": "Penicillin, cephalosporins, and erythromycin do not have the ability to chelate with calcium. Tetracycline, on the other hand, is known to chelate with calcium, which is why it is not recommended to be taken with milk or other calcium-rich foods as it can affect the absorption of the antibiotic.", "answer_choice": "B. Tetracycline"}
